pullRequest.title: [Bugfix] Grading Configuration sum of test case weights 0
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features locally
 Server: I followed the coding and design guidelines.
 Server: I added multiple integration tests (Spring) related to the features (with a high test coverage)
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.
 Client: I followed the coding and design guidelines.
 Client: I added client tests
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context


Fixes Sentry issues:

https://sentry.io/organizations/ls1intum/issues/2062065732/?environment=prod&project=1440029&query=is%3Aunresolved+assigned%3Ame&statsPeriod=14d
https://sentry.io/organizations/ls1intum/issues/2062065695/?environment=prod&project=1440029&query=is%3Aunresolved+assigned%3Ame&statsPeriod=14d

Description


Added check on server to make sure that sum of weights is not <=0
Added check on client to make sure that sum of weights is not <=0

Steps for Testing


Log in to Artemis
Navigate to Course Administration
Go to Programming Exercise section and click on Grading button of a exercise
Set all weights to 0 and klick on save button
Check that a error alert pops up.
Play around with the weights, everything should work as expected
6.1 Try also different scenarios for setting all weights to 0 e.g. First halft set to 0 then save -> should work, second half set to 0 -> should not work, or set all weights to 0 except of 1 weight and then set the last weight to 0

Test Coverage



Screenshots

commit.message: throw error when the sum of all test case weights are <= 0
fix check as it was on the wrong place
add check also on client to

nodes.bodyText: This can/should simplify to return sumOfWeightNewTestCases > 0;.
I do not think you need fakeAsync here. I removed both this and the ticks and it still works
This and the ticks seems not needed. I removed them and it still works. The component is recreated in the beforeEach already
Will getWeight ever return null? I think this method will fail in this case. I am asking because I think in the client you are testinf if weight is undefined

commit.message: integrate feedback for weight calculation on client
